title_gu: પ્રકરણ ૧૨૨: ચરોતર દેશના હરિજનનાં નામ કહ્યાં
title_trans: Prakaran 122: Charotar Deshnā Harijannā Nām Kahyā

gujarati.couplet:
ચવું જન ચડોતરનાં જેનાં ઉજ્જવલ અંતઃકરણ 
તન મન ધન અર્પણ કરી થયાં સ્વામીશ્રીજીને શરણ
gujarati.context: The devotee's heart is illuminated by the divine, and they surrender their mind, wealth, and soul to God, seeking shelter under His protection.

gujarati.couplet:
ભાવ ભક્તિ ઉરે અતિ એકમનાં નર ને નાર્ય 
પુરુષોત્તમ પ્રકટ સ્પર્શી ઊતર્યાં ભવપાર
gujarati.context: The passion and devotion are intense, like the mighty roar of one man; The divine touch ignites, and worldly desires fade away.

gujarati.couplet:
જેને એક હરિનો આશરો તેહ વિના બીજું હરામ 
એવા જન પાવનનાં હવે લખું કાંયેક નામ
gujarati.context:
Those who have a glimpse of God's love, are blessed with nothing else to worry about; they are the fortunate ones.

Those who are favored by God will now write something or other in their name.

gujarati.couplet:
વંદુ વરતાલનાં હરિજન અતિ પવિત્ર પરમ પાવન 
જિયાં હરિએ કરી બહુ લીલા લઈ સંત સતસંગી ભેળા
gujarati.context: The poor and oppressed are dear to God, and He takes great care of them; He has played many games with them and taken their souls in His holy company.

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ ભક્ત મોટેરા બાપુજી રણછોડે લીધા હરિ ભજી 
બેચર દાજી ને જેસંગભાઈ મૂલજી ને રાયજી કહેવાઇ
gujarati.context: Patel Bhakt worships Bapujee with devotion, and obtains Hari's divine pleasure; similarly, a foolish person gets fooled by someone else's deceit.

gujarati.couplet:
દો ભાઈજી દાદોભાઈ કહીએ જોરો નરશી નરોત્તમ લહીએ 
કાનદાસ ડુંગર ને દલો શામળ હરિ ધોરી મીઠો ભલો
gujarati.context: The uncle and father are saying that one should take a stand against injustice, just like a mountain (Kanadas) stands firm despite being worn down by rain; God's path is sweet and true.

gujarati.couplet:
લાલદાસ આદિ હરિજન પટેલ વાલુ કંકુબા પાવન 
દ્વિજ વનમાળી હરિદાસ બા અવલને પ્રભુની આશ

નકિ ભક્ત નારણગર બાવો જેણે કર્યો કુળનો અભાવો 
પ્રેમી ભક્ત પગી ધન્ય ધન્ય જનમાં શિરોમણિ જોબન
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a devotee who has renounced worldly attachments and is focused on spiritual growth, leaving behind the noise of the material world.

gujarati.couplet:
સુંદર ખોડો જુંસો ને વખતો જગો ભવાન જખતો હમતો 
ઊજમ અમરા આદિ કોળી ભાઈ જન એક રળિયાત બાઈ
gujarati.context: Beauty is in the imperfections of a person, and God is pleased with those who are grateful for what they have.

gujarati.couplet:
રગો બેચર વાસણ ઠાર બાઈ કંકુયે તજ્યો સંસાર 
ઠકર ઉકા આદિ બહુ કહીએ શૂદ્ર શવાદિ વરતાલ્યે લહીએ
gujarati.context: A foolish person wanders in worldly pleasures, unaware of the consequences that will follow. They should learn from others' mistakes and not repeat the same errors themselves.

gujarati.couplet:
કોળી ભક્ત તખો આસકરણ જેઠો બાદર હરિને શરણ 
ઝાલો જાલ્યમ ભક્ત ભાઈજી જગ આશ આશજીએ તજી
gujarati.context:
A devotee of God is like a Koli bird that seeks shelter; the soul finds solace in the Lord's sanctuary.

The devotee's heart beats with love and yearns for spiritual liberation, just as a bird longs to soar in the open sky.

gujarati.couplet:
માનબા જિતબા હરિજન નવલબા પ્રાણબા પાવન 
એહ આદિ જન બહુ કહીએ વસે ભક્ત એ બામણોલિયે
gujarati.context: The humble and pure-hearted Harijan will triumph, their life-breath is divine. One who says this is a devoted Bhakt, a devotee of the Lord.

gujarati.couplet:
જાંબુબા લીંબુબા નાની બાઈ રહે પરે બામણોલી માંઇ 
પટેલ ભક્ત કુબેર મૂળજી જીજી બાજી પુંજો ને રામજી
gujarati.context: The couplet is a playful and whimsical description of a young girl's behavior, likening her to a mischievous spirit who gets into trouble with others. The speaker also mentions the legendary king Kubera, suggesting a connection between the girl's antics and supernatural forces.

gujarati.couplet:
ધર્મદાસ ગોપાળ ગણીએ બાઈ રળિયાત નાથી ભણીએ 
ભક્ત ભાઈબા ધુનો ગઢવી કંકુ મધુબાને ભક્તિ હવી
gujarati.context: Gopala is considered a devotee of God, and even the most stubborn soul can be brought to devotion through his love; with Gopala's faith, even the hardest heart can be softened like ripe mangoes.

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ ભક્ત એક ઇચ્છારામ એહાદિ જન નરસંડે ગામ 
પટેલ ભક્ત નરહરભાઈ હરિજન છે બેચર નાઇ
gujarati.context: A devout person has only one desire, to be with the Lord; a Patel devotee is not considered worthy if they are not noble-born.

gujarati.couplet:
એહ આદિ બીજાં જન બહુ વસે ગામ ઉત્તરસંડે સહુ 
પટેલ ભક્ત કાળિદાસ નામ ભજે હરિ અલિંદરે ગામ
gujarati.context: This Gujarati couplet praises the community of Kalidas Patel, who is a devotee of God Hari and worships Him in every village. It highlights the spiritual leader's presence and influence across various villages.

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ ભક્ત કહીએ તે ઇશ્વર પ્રેમી જન વળી પીતાંબર 
વેણી લક્ષ્મી લટકણબાઈ પાટીદાર રૂડા અજુભાઈ
gujarati.context: A devotee of God says that a loving person is one who has wept and suffered; the wealth of love shines brightly, but is soon ruined by pride.

gujarati.couplet:
ભાટ બળિયો જાલમ ધર્મદાસ ભાવસંગનો મુમધે વાસ 
ક્ષત્રી ભક્ત છે રૂડા રામોજી પટેલમાં ભક્ત દાસ ખોજી
gujarati.context: The couplet compares the devotion of a warrior (Kshatriya) to God, saying it surpasses that of even the most devout Patel devotee. The warrior's devotion is likened to a precious jewel, exceeding that of others in its purity and sincerity.

gujarati.couplet:
લાલદાસ ને ઈશ્વરદાસ પ્રભુદાસ રઘે તજી કાશ 
દ્વિજ ભક્ત બાપુભાઈ નામ સદાશિવ ને નિરભેરામ
gujarati.context: Bapu Bhai's name is synonymous with devotion, and he is eternal and timeless like Lord Shiva.

gujarati.couplet:
રુડો ભક્ત કહીએ રામો નાઇ એહાદિ જન કણઝરી માંઇ 
કોળી ભક્ત વખતો વખાણું વાલો દાજી હરિજન જાણું
gujarati.context: The humble devotee says there is no need for pomp and show, as true devotion lies in the simplicity of one's heart. The lowly devotee seeks only to sing the praises of God, without worrying about external appearances or social status.

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ ભક્ત છે થોભણદાસ એહનો સામરખામાં વાસ 
દ્વિજ ભક્ત દિનકર નામ સદાશિવ ને લક્ષમીરામ
gujarati.context: Patel is a devotee of Thobhundas and has his abode in the temple; he is called Dinakar, Lakshmiram at Sadashiv's place.

gujarati.couplet:
દુર્લભરામ ને દેવશંકર કણબી ભક્ત હરજી સુંદર 
હરિજન એક દત્તબાઈ એહ આદિ તે આણંદ માંઇ
gujarati.context: A rare and precious gem is like God's own gift, a beautiful devotee who is full of joy and bliss. It is only one's own soul that brings complete delight and happiness.

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત કાછિયો નામ વસન વસે બાકરોલીએ હરિજન 
પટેલ ભક્ત લાલદાસ લહીએ જોરો રગનાથ નામ કહીએ
gujarati.context: A devotee's name is Vasna, and God resides in the heart of a lowly person; Patel Bhakt Laladas weeps as he utters the name "God" with devotion.

gujarati.couplet:
પ્રભુદાસ શંભુદાસ સોઈ ઠાર ધનજી સમ નહિ કોઈ 
એહ આદિ બીજાં બહુ જન વસે ગામ ગાનામાં પાવન
gujarati.context:
Lord's blessings are all that matter, not wealth or status; 
This life is short, so let's enjoy it with loved ones in the village.

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ ભક્ત રામદાસ જેહ હરિજન પ્રભુદાસ તેહ 
કોળી ભક્ત હેમતો ખુશાલો હરિભક્ત જાણો વળી ઝાલો
gujarati.context: A Patel worships Ramdas, while a Harijan worships Prabodhas; both are blessed by God's grace. A Kolhi devotee is filled with joy and dances with ecstasy, knowing the Lord's love.

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત સુતાર છે પ્રભુદાસ એહાદિ જનનો જોળે વાસ 
પટેલ ભક્ત છે ગરીબદાસ દાજી મનોહર રહે પાસ
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet in 1-2 lines:

The devotee sleeps peacefully, his soul connected to the Lord's abode. Similarly, Patel, a devotee of God, has a beautiful and enlightened mind.

gujarati.couplet:
કોળી ભક્ત ઊકો ને ઊજમ ઝુમો ભક્ત ભજે પરબ્રહ્મ 
હરિજન દ્વિજ વજેરામ રળિયાત રહે સંજાયે ગામ
gujarati.context: A devout devotee worships the divine in joy and enthusiasm; a lowly person's virtues are recognized, their village is blessed with peace.

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ ભક્ત ગોવિંદજી જાણો ગોપાલજી ગણેશ પ્રમાણો 
કોળી ઝુમો ભીખો ભગત ભલે શૂદ્ર ખોજીદાસ આખડોલે
gujarati.context: The couplet praises Patel Bhakt Gopaldasji for his devotion, comparing it to the greatness of Lord Krishna and Ganesha. It also emphasizes that even a lowly "Koli" (a community considered as untouchable) can attain spiritual heights through selfless devotion like Bhagat Behlol.

gujarati.couplet:
કોળી ભક્ત થોભણ બેચર વસે વલેટવે ભક્ત સુંદર 
દ્વિજ દાજીની ભક્તિ છે ખરી વસે બાંધણિયે ભજે હરિ
gujarati.context:
The devotee is a foolish child, yet the Lord's beauty dwells in them; it is true devotion that is the gift of the twice-born.

Their devotion is true, and they worship Hari with unwavering faith.

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ ભક્ત અજુજી સુંદર ખુશાલ કાનજી મનોહર 
જીજી જેસંગ ને પુંજો લહીએ સોની પીતાંબર વેણી કહીએ
gujarati.context: A devotee's soul is beautiful and colorful, like a lovely canvas; his words are as sweet as sonorous bells.

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત માણ્યકબાઈ સુતાર એહ ભક્ત મેળાવ્ય મોઝાર 
ભાટ ભક્ત નથુ લખો જોડ ફૂલો તકતો રામો રણછોડ
gujarati.context: The devout one (bhakt) has been sleeping (sutaar), but the Lord has woken them up; now, don't write this off as mere imagination, for flowers bloom into divine joy.

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ રઘો ગોકળ શીધર ભક્ત ખતરી જીવો સુંદર 
ભક્ત ભાટ એક જશબાઈ એહ આદિ જન ચાંગા માંઇ
gujarati.context: The faithful soul is as beautiful as the Gokul's cowherd, Patel Raghuvir. Just like a devotee's heart beats with one love, so does this devotee's life sing praises to God.

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ ભક્ત પ્રભુદાસ કહીએ ઓધવ કાનદાસ આદિ લહીએ 
વસે ગામ રોયણે એ જન કરે સ્વામીશ્રીજીનું ભજન
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

The great Bhakt Prahladadas says that Patel Bhakta, along with others like Ondhav Kanadas, etc., have been born in this village; they engage in worshipping their Lord Shreeji.

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ ભક્ત વાલોભાઈ નામ ઇચ્છારામ દાદો મયારામ 
ભક્ત ભવાનીશંકર જાણો રૂડા રામશંકર વખાણો
gujarati.context: The devotee's name is Valobhai Nam, and their grandfather's name is Ichcharam Maayarum; the devotee knows Bhavani Shankar and praises Rudra Ram Shankar.

gujarati.couplet:
રૂડાં બાઈ જમના જતન એહ આદિ દ્વિજ હરિજન 
પટેલ ભક્ત વાલોભાઈ કહીએ જગો વજેસંગ તુલસી લહીએ
gujarati.context: The Gujarati couplet describes a humble and pious person who is devoted to God, just like Tulsi, the legendary poet-saint.

gujarati.couplet:
ધોરી ખોડો જીજી ને હાંસજી રણછોડ ગોકળ રાયજી 
ઠકર કૃષ્ણ કાછિયો ભૂખણ શિવો ગઢવી ગાય હરિગુણ
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the devotion of Lord Krishna's devotees, who are willing to follow Him like a cow follows its calf, and their hunger is only for His name.

gujarati.couplet:
શા ઝવેર પ્રભુદાસ કડિયો જેને સતસંગ જીવશું જડિયો 
એહ આદિ બહુ બાઈ ભાઈ વસે ભક્ત વસોગામ માંઇ
gujarati.context: It is said that Prabhu Das lived a pious life with good company, and it's the beginning of great things; this divine meeting place welcomes devotees who dwell here.

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ ભક્ત છે રાયજી નામે કાળિદાસ રહે પલાણે ગામે 
પટેલ ભક્ત રૂડો રામદાસ ધર્મદાસ ભજે અવિનાશ
gujarati.context: The couplet describes two great souls: Patel Bhakt, a devotee named Raya Ji, and Kālidās who lives in a village; and Rudra Rāmdās, a devotee of God who worships Him forever.

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ ભક્ત મોટા માણ્યકજી રધવાણે લુહાર ભાઈજી 
ભક્ત ભાવસાર પ્રેમચંદ પીતાંબર લાલદાસાદિ વૃંદ
gujarati.context:
Here is a summarization of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The devout one, Bhakt Mota, has a deep affection for Radhavane and his brothers; he loves them like Pitaambar, Laladasad, and their family.

gujarati.couplet:
મોટાં ભક્ત માનકુંવર્યબાઈ ખરાં હરિજન ખેડા માંઇ 
સોની ભક્ત છે ગિરધર નામ માતર્યે દ્વિજ ઉત્તમરામ
gujarati.context: A great devotee is one who cultivates humility, just like a lowly farmer tends to his land. The true name of such a devotee is Giridhar, and only he is worthy of being called "Uttam Ram" (the best).

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ ભક્ત વાસણ ધર્મદાસ હરિભાઈને હરિની આશ 
દ્વિજ ભક્ત છે અનુપરામ એહ જન અલિંદરે ગામ
gujarati.context: The Patel devotee is a servant of God, seeking shelter under His divine protection. This pure soul is blessed by God and has no worries in this world or the next.

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ ભક્ત જીવણદાસ જેહ વસે ગામ હિરંજમાં તેહ 
ક્ષત્રી ભક્ત છે ભીમજી નામ વાસણજી વસે દેવગામ
gujarati.context:
The Patel devotee, Jeevanadas Jiha, resides in the village Hirajam; 
The Kshatriya devotee is Bhimji named, Vasni Ji resides in Devagam.

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ ભવાનીશંકર નામ પ્રભાશંકર કેશવરામ 
તુલજારામ દયારામ દાજી જન ખુશાલાદિ મન રાજી
gujarati.context: The name is Bhavanishankar, a combination of Prabhashanker and Kesvaram; the heart is filled with joy and contentment.

gujarati.couplet:
હરિજન હેતબાઈ જીજી કોળી ભક્ત છે નામ બોનજી 
પટેલ ભક્ત કહીએ લાલોજી જીભાઈ વ્રજભાઈ નાથજી
gujarati.context: The dalit (lower caste) is devoted to God's name, and the Patels are devotees of Laloji; one's own community is not considered as pure.

gujarati.couplet:
ગિરધર બેચર છે નામ સુતાર કલ્યાણ ગંગારામ 
સોની ગોપાળ આદિ હરિજન વસે પિપલાવ્યમાં પાવન
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet:

Giridhar is a name, not a fool, and his true name is Kalyan Gangaram; others like Soni Gopal are Harijans who live in Pipalav village.

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ ભક્ત રાયજી કાવે એકલો જન રહે ઈસણાવે 
પટેલ ભક્ત ગોવિંદજી નામ દ્વિજ પુરુષોત્તમ ઉત્તમરામ
gujarati.context:
The devotee Patel bhakta Rayji writes poetry, alone he stays in the wilderness; 
Patel bhakta Gopinathji's name is divine, a great soul, perfect and supreme.

gujarati.couplet:
હરિજન દ્વિજ હર્ખબાઈ પ્રેમી જન એ પાળજ માંઇ 
રૂડો ભક્ત છે રઈમ શેખ ભક્ત સુતાર અમથો એક
gujarati.context: A Harjani person is a true devotee and has love for all; a genuine devotee is one who sits with others at the same level.

gujarati.couplet:
વૈશ્ય વલ્લભ જીવો લુવાર ખરો ભક્ત ખતરી મોરાર 
બહુ હરિજન એહ આદ્યે વસે ભક્ત પ્રેમી પેટલાદે
gujarati.context: The virtuous and humble should be the ones to worship, not those who put themselves in danger. Many low-caste devotees are present here, filled with love and devotion.

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ ભક્ત રુગનાથ કહીએ કાળિદાસ ને કુબેર લહીએ 
એહ આદિ ભક્ત બાઈ ભાઈ વસે ગામ સુંદરણા માંઇ
gujarati.context: The poet says that the great Kalidas was lifted by Kubera, just as Patel bhakts (devotees) elevate the mundane village to a beautiful heaven.

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ ભક્ત કાશીદાસ સારો રામદાસ પ્રભુજીને પ્યારો 
વેરિભાઈ કાછિયો કહેવાય એહ જન બોચાસણ માંય
gujarati.context: The Patel devotees praise Kashi Das as the best, and Ramdas loves the Lord; everyone is a child in this world's game.

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ પ્રભુદાસ નિરમળ ભક્ત રામદાસ અવિચળ 
હાથી ઉત્તમ ને કાળિદાસ એહ જનનો વેરામાં વાસ
gujarati.context: Patel Prabhuadas is pure and Ramadas is devoted; while Kalidas excels in his literary work, our soul is stuck in this world's veil.

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ મૂળજી થોભણ ભણીએ નરસી હરિ વેણીદાસ ગણીએ 
દેવબાઈને ભાવ છે ભલો કોળી રંગબાઈ ભાઈ ગલો
gujarati.context: Patel's wisdom is unmatched, and Narsi Mehta is considered a devotee of Lord Hari; the emotions of Devabai are like colors, which turn into joy when shared with others.

gujarati.couplet:
રાઠોડ એક ભક્ત રાજબાઈ એહાદિ વસે દદર્ડા માંઇ 
પટેલ ભક્ત લાલદાસભાઈ જાદવ વળી વિઠલ નાઇ
gujarati.context: A devotee named Rajbhai lives in Rauthod, and a devout Laladasbhay is found among the Patel community; a devotee named Vitthal is not present among the Jadhav group.

gujarati.couplet:
કોળી ભક્ત તે હિમતો કહીએ એહ આદિ બોરસદે લહીએ 
પટેલ ભક્ત જેઠોભાઈ જાણો ખોડો ગુમાન કોળી પ્રમાણો
gujarati.context: The devotee from Kolhi community says that the Lord's mercy is limitless, just like a never-ending river; and Patel devotees know this truth well, just as they know their own ancestral land.

gujarati.couplet:
એહ આદિ છે જન અવલ દાસ સ્વામીના વસે દાવોલ 
પટેલ ભક્ત છે બેચરદાસ એહ દાસનો બોદાલે વાસ
gujarati.context: This couplet describes the humble nature of a servant who dedicates himself to his master's will, never questioning or complaining. The speaker praises the devotion and obedience of this servant, Patel Bhakt, as he willingly submits to the whims of his master.

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત પટેલ નામ બાપુજી રહે જોશીકૂવે કુસંગ તજી 
દ્વિજ ભક્ત નારણજી જેરામ જન જીવી ઉકલાવ્ય ગામ
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet in English:

Bapuji Patel, a devotee, has gone to meet his Lord; meanwhile, Narayanji Ramaraam lives on, farming his village.

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ ભક્ત છે બાપુજી સારો વસે વાસદે પ્રભુને પ્યારો 
ભક્ત સુતાર દયાળજી કહીએ મીઠો ભગવાન ભક્ત લહીએ
gujarati.context: A Patel devotee is blessed by Bapujee, dwelling in the Lord's love; the devoted soul sleeps with God's mercy and awakens to sweet divine affection.

gujarati.couplet:
કોળી ભક્ત દાદોભાઈ જાણો હરિભાઈ ભગુજી પ્રમાણો 
હરિજન કહીએ જોરોભાઈ એહાદિ જન ચમારા માંઇ
gujarati.context: The devotees of God are known by their actions, not by their birth; true devotion is revealed in the service one does with humility and a pure heart.

gujarati.couplet:
પટેલ ભક્ત રણછોડદાસ બાપુજીયે તજી જગઆશ 
વેરિદાસ પ્રાગદાસ દલો હરિ ડુંગર વસતો ભલો
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The devotee Pateal Bhakta Rancho Das, his heart is full of devotion to Lord Krishna; with faith in God, he faces all challenges with ease.

gujarati.couplet:
દ્વિજ ભક્ત ખોડો કુશલરામ ભજ્યા બેચરે સુંદર શ્યામ 
ભક્ત ભાટ કેશર નિદાન રુગનાથ મોટભા ગુમાન
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

A devotee, even if imperfect, can worship Lord Krishna with beauty and devotion; however, an ignorant person's worship is like offering a burnt sacrifice.

gujarati.couplet:
ભક્ત લુવાર છે વણારશી જેને હૈયે રહ્યા હરિ વસી 
કોળી ભક્ત જગન્નાથ ધીર ભક્ત ભગવાનદાસ હમીર
gujarati.context: The devout is like a bee, always seeking the Lord's presence; The devotee of Jagannath is steadfast and true to their faith.

gujarati.couplet:
હરિજન છે બાઈ ખુશાલી જેને ભક્તિ હરિની છે વાલી 
એહ આદિ બીજાં બાઈ ભાઈ વસે ભક્ત બામણગામ માંઇ
gujarati.context: The humble ones (Harijan) are blessed and joyful, with devotion to Hari in their hearts. They reside in the sacred place of Bamangam, where devotees gather.

gujarati.couplet:
અપરિમાણનું પરમાણ નહિ અકળ કળે નહિ કોય 
એમ હરિજન આજનાં નાવે સંખ્યામાં સોય
gujarati.context: The infinite cannot be measured, nor can the limits of the unattainable be known; only those who are chosen by God can know their fate today.

gujarati.couplet:
કહી કહી કહીએ કેટલાં છે આજ અલેખે વાત 
કવિની પહોંચ્ય કિયાં લગી ભરવી આભશું બાથ
gujarati.context: The speaker is saying that there's no end to their complaints, but today's news is the worst; a poet has reached new depths of sorrow and despair.

transliteration.couplet:
Chavu jan Chaḍotarnā, jenā ujjaval antahkaraṇ; <RHYME_1>
Tan man dhan arpaṇ karī, thayā Swāmī-Shrījīne sharaṇ.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: The couplet speaks to the importance of cultivating a strong and enlightened mind (ujjaval antahkaraṇ) and seeking refuge in one's spiritual guide or guru. By doing so, one can achieve spiritual growth and protection from worldly distractions.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhāv bhakti ure ati, ekmanā nar ne nārya; <RHYME_2>
Puruṣhottam prakaṭ sparshī, ūtaryā bhavpār.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context: The devotion to the divine is intense and all-encompassing, transcending human limitations of men and women alike. The supreme being is revealed in a direct, tangible experience, beyond mere understanding.

transliteration.couplet:
Jene ek Harino āsharo, teh vinā bīju harām; <RHYME_3>
Evā jan pāvannā, have lakhu kāyek nām.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context: One who has not sown a single seed, but without fail will reap the fruits of others' labor; similarly, one who has not learned a single letter, yet will attain the fame of many names.

transliteration.couplet:
Vandu Varatālnā harijan, ati pavitra param pāvan; <RHYME_4>
Jiyā Harie karī bahu līlā, laī sant satasangī bheḷā.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context: The virtuous and pure Harijans are blessed by God, and their sacred gathering is filled with spiritual joy. Their life is a beautiful play of love, filled with divine harmony.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṭel bhakta Moṭerā Bāpujī, Raṇchhoḍe līdhā Hari bhajī; <RHYME_5>
Bechar Dājī ne Jesangbhāī, Mūljī ne Rāyajī kahevāi.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context: The devotee Moṭerā Bāpujī is in deep love with God, and Raṇchhoḍe līdhā Hari bhajī implies a strong devotion to Lord Krishna.

transliteration.couplet:
Do bhāījī Dādobhāī kahīe, Joro Narashī Narottam lahīe; <RHYME_6>
Kānadās Ḍungar ne Dalo, Shāmaḷ Hari Dhorī Mīṭho bhalo.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context: The couplet is about a brother-in-law and sister-in-law having a quarrel, and then making up as if they didn't have the fight. The speaker describes this scenario as similar to how the mighty Dungar mountain was worn down by the constant rain.

transliteration.couplet:
Lāladās ādi harijan, Paṭel Vālu Kankubā pāvan; <RHYME_7>
Dvij Vanamāḷī haridās, Bā Avalne Prabhunī āsh.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes two devotees of Lord Krishna: Lāladās and Paṭel Vālu Kankubā, who are worthy of praise; and Dvij Vanamāḷī Haridās and Bā Avalne Prabhunī, who seek shelter under His divine guidance.

transliteration.couplet:
Naki bhakta Nāraṇagar Bāvo, jeṇe karyo kuḷno abhāvo; <RHYME_8>
Premī bhakta Pagī dhanya dhanya, janmā shiromaṇi Joban.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context: The devotee of God is without any defects or shortcomings, as they perform their duties sincerely. The lover's heart is filled with gratitude and joy, like a bridegroom on his wedding day.

transliteration.couplet:
Sundar Khoḍo Junso ne Vakhato, Jago Bhavā Jakhato Hamato; <RHYME_9>
Ūjam Amarā ādi koḷī bhāī, jan ek Raḷiyāt bāī.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context: A beautiful and rare person is found in a humble state, and one's soul is awakened by the same individual. One's own brother or friend is considered to be of great value.

transliteration.couplet:
Rago Bechar Vāsaṇ Ṭhār, bāī Kankuye tajyo sansār; <RHYME_10>
Ṭhakar Ukā ādi bahu kahīe, shūdra Shavādi Varatālye lahīe.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context: A person's life is like a fleeting dream, and the world is but a momentary dance; many stories are told about birth and death.

transliteration.couplet:
Koḷī bhakta Takho āsakaraṇ, Jeṭho Bādar Harine sharaṇ; <RHYME_11>
Zālo Jālyam bhakta bhāījī, jag āsh Āshajīe tajī.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context: A devotee is consumed by love for God and seeks refuge in His mercy, finding solace from the world's turmoil. The devotee's heart is filled with devotion and finds peace only when their soul merges with the divine.

transliteration.couplet:
Mānbā Jitbā harijan, Navalbā Prāṇbā pāvan; <RHYME_12>
Eh ādi jan bahu kahīe, vase bhakta e Bāmaṇoliye.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context: The couplet speaks of a humble person (Mānbā) who wins the world's admiration and a pure-hearted individual (Navalbā) who saves their life by doing good deeds; it also encourages one to speak little and keep the heart full of devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Jāmbubā Līmbubā Nānī bāī, rahe pare Bāmaṇolī māi; <RHYME_13>
Paṭel bhakta Kuber Mūḷjī, Jījī Bājī Punjo ne Rāmjī.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

A devotee named Paṭel was blessed by Goddess Bāmaṇolī, while Kuber Mūḷjī and Jījī Bājī Punjo sought blessings from Lord Rāmjī.

transliteration.couplet:
Dharmadās Gopāḷ gaṇīe, bāī Raḷiyāt Nāthī bhaṇīe; <RHYME_14>
Bhakta Bhāībā Dhuno Gaḍhavī, Kanku Madhubāne bhakti havī.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context: A devotee like me is hard to find, and one who understands my devotion is even rarer. My devotion is as sweet as the honey in the forest of Kanku, where it's savored by the gods.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta ek Ichchhārām, ehādi jan Narasanḍe gām; <RHYME_15>
Paṭel bhakta Narharbhāī, harijan chhe Bechar Nāi.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context: A devotee's home is where God resides, and even in a village like hell, it becomes a heaven. A true devotee is like Lord Narhari, and one who is humble like a child is blessed by God.

transliteration.couplet:
Eh ādi bījā jan bahu, vase gām Uttarsanḍe sahu; <RHYME_16>
Paṭel bhakta Kāḷidās nām, bhaje Hari Alindare gām.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context: This Gujarati couplet refers to a person named Uttarsan who has taken birth in the land of God (Hari) at Alindara, and is devotedly worshiping Lord Kaliydas as his devotee (bhakta).

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta kahīe te ishvar, premī jan vaḷī Pītāmbar; <RHYME_17>
Veṇī Lakṣhmī Laṭakaṇbāī, Pāṭīdār rūḍā Ajubhāī.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: The devotee calls God "Dvij Bhakta" and says that devotion is the key to reaching Him; just as Lakshmi's flute-like hands draw in the divine, so too does a true devotee's love attract God's attention.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhāṭ baḷiyo Jālam Dharmadās, Bhāvasangno Mumadhe vās; <RHYME_18>
Kṣhatrī bhakta chhe rūḍā Rāmojī, Paṭelmā bhakta dās Khojī.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context: A devotee of God is like a grain of rice (Bhāṭ), pure and simple. A royal devotee may be great, but a true lover of God is more exalted than even the king's servant.

transliteration.couplet:
Lāldās ne Īshvardās, Prabhudās Raghe tajī kāsh; <RHYME_19>
Dvij bhakta Bāpubhāī nām, Sadāshiv ne Nirabherām.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: The devotee Lāldās meets the Lord Īshvardās and gains spiritual insight. The Bhaktas (devotees) like Bāpubhāī attain eternal bliss with Sadāshiv, their ultimate goal.

transliteration.couplet:
Ruḍo bhakta kahīe Rāmo Nāi, ehādi jan Kaṇazarī māi; <RHYME_20>
Koḷī bhakta Vakhato vakhāṇu, vālo Dājī harijan jāṇu.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: A devotee (bhakta) is called Rāmo Nāi, and the one who understands this sacred love; Only those who are pure in their devotion can understand God's true form.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṭel bhakta chhe Thobhaṇdās, ehano Sāmarkhāmā vās; <RHYME_21>
Dvij bhakta Dinakar nām, Sadāshiv ne Lakṣhamīrām.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context: Patel is a devotee of Thobhaṇdās and resides in Sāmarkhāmā, while Dvij is a devotee named Dinakar who is dear to Sadāshiv.

transliteration.couplet:
Durlabhrām ne Devshankar, kaṇabī bhakta Harajī sundar; <RHYME_22>
Harijan ek Dattabāī, eh ādi te Āṇand māi.  <RHYME_22>
transliteration.context: The devotee of God is difficult to find, just like a rare gem; only one who has achieved devotion can enjoy eternal bliss.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta Kāchhiyo nām Vasan, vase Bākarolīe harijan; <RHYME_23>
Paṭel bhakta Lāldās lahīe, Joro Raganāth nām kahīe.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context: A devotee's name is Vasna, and they worship the Lord in a simple hut; Another devotee, Patel, has given up worldly pleasures, offering his life to the Lord.

transliteration.couplet:
Prabhudās Shambhudās soī, Ṭhār Dhanajī sam nahi koī; <RHYME_24>
Eh ādi bījā bahu jan, vase gām Gānāmā pāvan.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the greatness of someone like Prabhu or Shambhu, whose wealth is beyond compare. The second line means that many people are born from a single seed, and similarly, a village can be nourished by its own resources.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṭel bhakta Rāmdās jeh, harijan Prabhudās teh; <RHYME_25>
Koḷī bhakta Hemato Khushālo, haribhakta jāṇo vaḷī Zālo.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The devotee Rāmdās is like a Patel, and Prabhudās is like God; Hemato Khushālo is like a devotee of Koḷī and Jāṇo Zālo is like one who knows God.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta Sutār chhe Prabhudās, ehādi janno Joḷe vās; <RHYME_26>
Paṭel bhakta chhe Garībdās, Dājī Manohar rahe pās.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: A devotee (Bhakta) is always with the Lord (Prabhudās), his home being worship; another devotee (Paṭel Bhakta) is Garībdās, with Dājī Manohar by his side.

transliteration.couplet:
Koḷī bhakta Ūko ne Ūjam, Zumo bhakta bhaje Parabrahma; <RHYME_27>
Harijan dvij Vajerām, raḷiyāt rahe Sanjāye gām.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: The devotee of the material world chases worldly desires, while the devotee of the Supreme Being worships God. The two paths are like different rivers flowing towards their respective destinations.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṭel bhakta Govindajī jāṇo, Gopālajī Gaṇesh pramāṇo; <RHYME_28>
Koḷī Zumo Bhīkho bhagat bhale, shūdra Khojīdās Ākhaḍole.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context: Govindaji and Gopala are revered as devotees of God, with Govindaji being considered the true worshipper. A humble Bhikhoo is a devotee of God, while even Shudra Kojīdās has reached spiritual heights through devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Koḷī bhakta Thobhaṇ Bechar, vase Valeṭave bhakta sundar; <RHYME_29>
Dvij Dājīnī bhakti chhe kharī, vase Bāndhaṇiye bhaje Hari.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: The devotee is beautiful when their love for God is pure and true, just like a fragrant flower that blooms in the heart. The bond of devotion between a devotee and God is stronger than any earthly tie.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṭel bhakta Ajujī sundar, khushāl Kānjī manohar; <RHYME_30>
Jījī Jesang ne Punjo lahīe, Sonī Pītāmbar veṇī kahīe.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: The beautiful Ajujī is a devoted follower of Patel, and Kānjī's lovely thoughts are captivating. The clever Jesang has composed Punjo's story, and Sonī's colorful tale is being told through her song.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta Māṇyakbāī sutār, eh bhakta Meḷāvya mozār; <RHYME_31>
Bhāṭ bhakta Nathu Lakho joḍ, Fūlo Takato Rāmo Raṇchhoḍ.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

A devotee's love is boundless, like that of Bhakta Māṇyakbāī and Meḷāvya. Similarly, one's devotion to God should be like that of Nathu Lakho and Takato Rāmo.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṭel Ragho Gokaḷ Shīdhar, bhakta Khatarī Jīvo sundar; <RHYME_32>
Bhakta Bhāṭ ek Jashbāī, eh ādi jan Chāngā māi.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization:

Paṭel Ragho Gokaḷ Shīdhar was a devoted devotee and Khatarī Jīvo was beautiful; Bhakta Bhāṭ was a single-hearted person, having great faith in the Lord.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṭel bhakta Prabhudās kahīe, Odhav Kāndās ādi lahīe; <RHYME_33>
Vase gām Royaṇe e jan, kare Swāmī-Shrījīnu bhajan.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context: Prabhudas, a devotee of God, sings Bhakti songs, while Odhav Kand and others play instruments to harmonize the devotional atmosphere. The people in Royane village gather to worship and sing praises to the Lord with devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta Vālobhāī nām, Ichchhārām Dādo Mayārām; <RHYME_34>
Bhakta Bhavānīshankar jāṇo, rūḍā Rāmashankar vakhāṇo.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context: A devotee of the Lord is called Vālobhāī, and Mayārām bestows their desires; know that Bhakta's form is Bhavānīshankar, while Rāmashankar speaks his words.

transliteration.couplet:
Rūḍā bāī Jamanā jatan, eh ādi dvij harijan; <RHYME_35>
Paṭel bhakta Vālobhāī kahīe, Jago Vajesang Tulasī lahīe.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the devotion of two people, Rūḍā and Jamanā, who are considered as high-caste devotees of Lord Hari. They worship with great enthusiasm, just like Vālobhāī and Tulasī, and ask for spiritual awakening.

transliteration.couplet:
Dhorī Khoḍo Jījī ne Hānsajī, Raṇachhoḍ Gokaḷ Rāyajī; <RHYME_36>
Ṭhakar Kṛuṣhṇa Kāchhiyo bhūkhaṇ, Shivo Gaḍhavī gāy Hari-guṇ.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the joyous celebrations of a wedding (Dhorī Khoḍo) and praises the virtues of Lord Krishna and Lord Shiva, with the refrain "Hari-guṇ" emphasizing devotion to God.

transliteration.couplet:
Shā Zaver Prabhudās kaḍiyo, jene satasang jīvashu jaḍiyo; <RHYME_37>
Eh ādi bahu bāī bhāī, vase bhakta Vasogām māi.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: The couplet says that one should consider the advice of elders and live a life guided by devotion to God, just like the devotees in Vaikunth. It emphasizes the importance of seeking guidance from wise people and being devoted to a higher power.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṭel bhakta chhe Rāyajī nāme, Kāḷidās rahe Palāṇe gāme; <RHYME_38>
Paṭel bhakta rūḍo Rāmadās, Dharmadās bhaje Avināsh.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Rayaji and Kalidas are devotees in different villages, with Rayaji's devoté being Ramadas and Kalidas' being Avinash.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta moṭā Māṇyakjī, Radhavāṇe luhār Bhāījī; <RHYME_39>
Bhakta Bhāvasār Premchand, Pītāmbar Lāldāsādi vṛund.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context: A devotee's love is pure and true, as evident from his devotion to God.

transliteration.couplet:
Moṭā bhakta Mānkunvaryabāī, kharā harijan Kheḍā māi; <RHYME_40>
Sonī bhakta chhe Giradhar nām, Mātarye dvij Uttamrām.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context: A great devotee is like a tree with deep roots, and God's love is like the fertile soil that nourishes it. One who utters Giridhar's name has transcended the cycle of birth and death, achieving spiritual greatness.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṭel bhakta Vāsaṇ Dharmadās, Haribhāīne Harinī āsh; <RHYME_41>
Dvij bhakta chhe Anuprām, eh jan Alindare gām.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context: Vasaadharam and Haribhai are devoted to Lord Krishna's worship, seeking his divine love. Anupram is a devotee who has renounced worldly desires, residing in the spiritual realm of God.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṭel bhakta Jīvaṇdās jeh, vase gām Hiranjmā teh; <RHYME_42>
Kṣhatrī bhakta chhe Bhīmajī nām, Vāsaṇjī vase Devagām.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The two devotees mentioned are Jivanadas from Hiraj village and Bhimanji from Vasajan village.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij Bhavānīshankar nām, Prabhāshankar Keshavrām; <RHYME_43>
Tulajārām Dayārām Dājī, jan Khushālādi man rājī.  <RHYME_43>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The names are Dvij Bhavānīshankar and Prabhāshankar Keshavrām, and they are devoted to their lord with compassion and mercy. Their hearts are full of joy and contentment in serving others.

transliteration.couplet:
Harijan Hetabāī Jījī, koḷī bhakta chhe nām Bonajī; <RHYME_44>
Paṭel bhakta kahīe Lālojī, Jībhāī Vrajbhāī Nāthajī.  <RHYME_44>
transliteration.context: The couplet is describing two types of devotees: one who seeks God's name (Harijan Hetabāī) and another who seeks a specific deity (Paṭel bhakta).

transliteration.couplet:
Giradhar Bechar chhe nām, sutār Kalyāṇ Gangārām; <RHYME_45>
Sonī Gopāḷ ādi harijan, vase Pipalāvyamā pāvan.  <RHYME_45>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summarization of the Gujarati couplet in English:

Giradhar Bechar is known by his name, and Kalyan Gangaram is his guru; Soni Gopaladi is a Harijan, and his home is in Pipalavam.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṭel bhakta Rāyajī kāve, ekalo jan rahe Īsaṇāve; <RHYME_46>
Paṭel bhakta Govindjī nām, dvij Puruṣhottam Uttamrām.  <RHYME_46>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The devotee Rāyajī was alone with his Lord, and Govindjī's name was like a bridge to Puruṣhottam Uttamrām.

transliteration.couplet:
Harijan dvij Harkhabāī, premī jan e Pāḷaj māi; <RHYME_47>
Rūḍo bhakta chhe Raīm Shekh, bhakta Sutār Amatho ek.  <RHYME_47>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes two types of devotees: the noble-minded Harijan and the noble-born Pāḷaj, both of whom are united in their love for God. The two lines also introduce two specific devotees, Raīm Shekh and Sutār Amatho, who embody this devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaishya Vallabh Jīvo luvār, kharo bhakta Khatarī Morār; <RHYME_48>
Bahu harijan eh ādye, vase bhakta premī Peṭalāde.  <RHYME_48>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the devotion of a merchant (Vaishya) to Lord Krishna and the risk he takes in loving Him, likening it to a devotee's love for God being like a flame that burns brightly despite the danger.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṭel bhakta Ruganāth kahīe, Kāḷidās ne Kuber lahīe; <RHYME_49>
Eh ādi bhakta bāī bhāī, vase gām Sundarṇā māi.  <RHYME_49>
transliteration.context: The devotee of Ruganath is said to be as good as Kuber, and Bhakti Dasa has taken his family's goddess Sundarini as their mother. This devotee is like a brother-in-law in their home.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṭel bhakta Kāshīdās sāro, Rāmadās Prabhujīne pyāro; <RHYME_50>
Veribhāī Kāchhiyo kahevāy, eh jan Bochāsaṇ māy.  <RHYME_50>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Paṭel's devotee Kashidas worships with devotion, while Ramadas loves God with all his heart. However, most people only pretend to worship, hiding their true intentions in disguise.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṭel Prabhudās niramaḷ, bhakta Rāmdās avichaḷ; <RHYME_51>
Hāthī Uttam ne Kāḷidās, eh janno Verāmā vās.  <RHYME_51>
transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet in English:

Prabhudas and Ramesh are friends, with Kaulidas being their companion, all living together harmoniously.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṭel Mūḷjī Thobhaṇ bhaṇīe, Narasī Hari Veṇīdās gaṇīe; <RHYME_52>
Devbāīne bhāv chhe bhalo, koḷī Rangbāī bhāī Galo.  <RHYME_52>
transliteration.context: The couplet is about the beauty of a woman being compared to the divine, with Paṭel Mūḷjī's words likening her to the goddess Rangbāī.

transliteration.couplet:
Rāṭhoḍ ek bhakta Rājbāī, ehādi vase Dadarḍā māi; <RHYME_53>
Paṭel bhakta Lāldāsbhāī, Jādav vaḷī Viṭhal Nāi.  <RHYME_53>
transliteration.context: There are two devotees mentioned: Rājbāī from Dadarḍā and Lāldāsbhāī from Paṭel, both of whom have devotion for their respective gods.

transliteration.couplet:
Koḷī bhakta te Himato kahīe, eh ādi Borsade lahīe; <RHYME_54>
Paṭel bhakta Jeṭhobhāī jāṇo, Khoḍo Gumān koḷī pramāṇo.  <RHYME_54>
transliteration.context: The devotee of God should know that the path to Him is not in grand deeds but in small, humble actions like sharing a leaf with others. A true devotee recognizes that even a small act of kindness, like giving a leaf, can be a measure of one's devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Eh ādi chhe jan aval, dās Swāmīnā vase Dāvol; <RHYME_55>
Paṭel bhakta chhe Bechardās, eh dāsno Bodāle vās.  <RHYME_55>
transliteration.context: The devotee is completely consumed by the Lord's love, and his soul resides in the Lord's lap; The true devotee is one who has renounced all worldly attachments.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta Paṭel nām Bāpujī, rahe Joshīkūve kusang tajī; <RHYME_56>
Dvij bhakta Nāraṇajī Jerām, jan Jīvī Ukalāvya gām.  <RHYME_56>
transliteration.context:
Here is a 1 to 2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

Bhakta Patel and Narajanji are devotees who have transcended worldly desires and attachments, and are now focused on their spiritual pursuits. They reside in holy places like Joshik and Ukalavaya, symbolizing their devotion to God.

transliteration.couplet:
Paṭel bhakta chhe Bāpujī sāro, vase Vāsade Prabhune pyāro; <RHYME_57>
Bhakta Sutār Dayāḷjī kahīe, Mīṭho Bhagwān bhakta lahīe.  <RHYME_57>
transliteration.context: The devotee is dear to Lord Krishna like a tender sprout to its stem. The loving devotion of the devotee is pleasing to God.

transliteration.couplet:
Koḷī bhakta Dādobhāī jāṇo, Haribhāī Bhagujī pramāṇo; <RHYME_58>
Harijan kahīe Jorobhāī, ehādi jan Chamārā māi.  <RHYME_58>
transliteration.context: The faithful servant Koḷī knows his place, and Haribhāī is the one who measures his worth. The Harijan (untouchable) Jorobhāī says, "My love is like Chamārā's mother."

transliteration.couplet:
Paṭel bhakta Raṇchhoḍdās, Bāpujīye tajī jag-āsh; <RHYME_59>
Veridās Prāgdās Dalo, Hari Ḍungar vasato bhalo.  <RHYME_59>
transliteration.context: The humble servant Ranchedas is devoted to his Lord Bapu, and has renounced worldly attachment; similarly, Veridas has offered his soul to God, and now resides in harmony with the divine.

transliteration.couplet:
Dvij bhakta Khoḍo Kushalrām, bhajyā Bechare sundar Shyām; <RHYME_60>
Bhakta Bhāṭ Keshar nidān, Ruganāth Moṭabhā gumān.  <RHYME_60>
transliteration.context: The devotee Kushalram is fortunate to have found the beautiful Shyam, while another devotee Bhat Keshar is stuck in sorrow and regret.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhakta luvār chhe Vaṇārashī, jene haiye rahyā Hari vasī; <RHYME_61>
Koḷī bhakta Jagannāth dhīr, bhakta Bhagwāndās Hamīr.  <RHYME_61>
transliteration.context: The devotee (bhakta) is one who resides in God's presence and remains focused on Him alone. Such a devotee is worthy of being called a true devotee of Lord Jagannath or Bhagwan Dada Hamir.

transliteration.couplet:
Harijan chhe bāī Khushālī, jene bhakti Harinī chhe vālī; <RHYME_62>
Eh ādi bījā bāī bhāī, vase bhakta Bāmaṇgām māi.  <RHYME_62>
transliteration.context: The couplet praises Lord Hari (Krishna) and Khushali, saying that devotion to Him brings joy. The phrase "vase bhakta" indicates that the speaker is a devotee of God, seeking solace in spiritual love.

transliteration.couplet:
Aparimāṇnu paramāṇ nahi, akaḷ kaḷe nahi koy; <RHYME_63>
Em harijan ājnā, nāve sankhyāmā soy.  <RHYME_63>
transliteration.context: Nothing is infinite, nor is anything finite; in the universe, nothing has a definite count. In my heart, I have counted the blessings of others and not mine.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahī kahī kahīe keṭalā, chhe āj alekhe vāt; <RHYME_64>
Kavinī pahochya kiyā lagī, bharavī ābhashu bāth.  <RHYME_64>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the sweet sound of a lover's whisper, likening it to the gentle breeze that rustles the leaves of a tree. The speaker has been longing for their loved one and is now finally able to converse with them.
